alert.note: Alert for Oconee; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 8:55PM EDT until September 07 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina... Northeastern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 855 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lake Keowee, or 8 miles west of Pickens, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Seneca, Walhalla, Six Mile, Salem, Lake Keowee, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Devils Fork State Park, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Table Rock State Park, Nine Times, Sunset, and Pumpkintown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
